Question: Will this gate be able to accommodate a top mounting width that is a little different than the bottom mounting width?
Answer: Maybe if they're not more than .5" different. It only lock latches on the top so that would need to be the narrower width. The bottom doesn't latch, it just slides into a metal bracket, so it could still close and latch on top if the bottom is a little wider. If the width was too different, the top might still latch, but a child could push on the bottom and get an arm/leg/head through so you might have to modify the bottom bracket by using a piece of filler wood between the bracket and the wall.

Question: How's the handling when trying to fold it up?  There's no handle to use and it doesn't stand on its own ... did this eventually become an annoyance?

Question: What is the correct fit? Should there be space all around the nipple or not?
Answer: As with regular flanges, your nipples shouldn't rub against the flange while in use. If there is some skin rubbing against the flange it should be very minimal. No skin should be left behind inside the flange. What ever size you use with normal flanges tells you what size you should use with the pumpin' pals. If you use a size under 25/26mm you should use the small, if you use 25/25 standard medium and any size larger than the standard 25/25 should use the large shield.

Question: Are these parts dishwasher safe?
Answer: They are dishwasher safe but it is not recommended that you leave the parts in the drying setting. Question: How do you loosen the harness straps? They are snug for snowsuits. Someone said press down and pull out. Press down what button & where? ty

Question: Does the top and bottom of the gate lock?

Question: Does the top and bottom of the gate lock?

Question: what does it mean that the battery life is 4 hours? How does that work? It wouldn't even last through the night then?
Answer: To clarify what others have said, the alarm unit can be plugged in permanently. The actual sensor pad that goes under the mattress needs AA batteries, and those last 3-4 months. There is a wire going from the sensor pad to the alarm unit, but that doesn't provide power to the sensor pad. There is also a low-battery warning on the alarm unit, so you don't have to worry about it dying unexpectedly.

Question: Will this work on metal banister/railing?
Answer: All the installation kit is is a pair of plastic clamps that hold onto the railing.  A wood bar attaches to the clamps with screws, and that piece of wood is how the fence attaches.  As long as the metal railing is thick enough, there won't be a problem.  And even if it's too thin, you could add a piece of rubber or padding to essentially make the railing thick enough to accept the minimum clamp allowance.  It's an extremely simple design, and one you could easily makeshift with a 1"x2"x3' pine board and two clamps from the hardware store.

Question: i am a size 36 d what size nipple sheld should i get
Answer: It has nothing to do with your breast size, but rather your nipples girth. Think of the diameter of just the nipple in millimeters.

Question: i am a size 36 d what size nipple sheld should i get
Answer: It depends on the size of your nipples, not the cup size.

Question: i am a size 36 d what size nipple sheld should i get
Answer: You'll need to be fitted by a lactation consultant (or maybe just a nurse), as it varies and isn't just based on cup size.

Question: i am a size 36 d what size nipple sheld should i get
Answer: One should always see a Board Certified Lactation Consultant, an IBCLC before using a product like this. It has nothing to do with bra size and should ONLY be used while under the care of a an IBCLC who is seeing your baby regularly, assessing your baby's intake and your latch and doing regular weights on the baby. These can do more harm than good if they are not used properly. M.J. IBCLC

Question: Better to be really snug fit around nipple or have a little extra room in there? Tried on two sizes, not sure which to get more of.
Answer: It's better to have a snug fit. First, if there is too much room there is more air in the shield and your baby will have to suck air before they get any milk, which makes a gassy, cranky baby. Second, the snug fit means that when baby latches it will have more contact with the actual nipple and keep up stimulation so you won't lose as much milk production. Even if it's a snug fit it will still protect your nipple from abrasion, but if it's too big you will find it harder to switch baby back to breast later.

Question: Better to be really snug fit around nipple or have a little extra room in there? Tried on two sizes, not sure which to get more of.
Answer: Better to have a snug fit

Question: Better to be really snug fit around nipple or have a little extra room in there? Tried on two sizes, not sure which to get more of.
Answer: Snug, but not too snug. If the nipple is constantly rubbing against the sides of the shield, it can get friction burn and start to hurt. Especially at the base.

Question: For those of you with flat nipples, were you able to wean off the nipple shield? If so, when and how did you do it?
Answer: Yes! Weaned successfully at around 4 months.

Question: Are these hard or soft flexible shields?
Answer: These are incredibly soft, flexible silicone.

Question: Can you leave the door open by just using like a weight to hold it open? Or will that add lots of resistance and break the spring?
Answer: The amount of spring tension on the device can be adjusted.You can set it to either slam shut with the force of a thousand suns or barely react; lower the resistance if you want to occasionally jam it with something.

Question: Can you leave the door open by just using like a weight to hold it open? Or will that add lots of resistance and break the spring?
Answer: You can prop it open, the force is very gentle, it's adjustable as well,,

Question: Are you able to disable the auto close feature if you want to keep the door open?
Answer: Not easily. You have to reverse the process of winding the spring - takes a minute, two hands and two screw rods...

Question: Are you able to disable the auto close feature if you want to keep the door open?
Answer: You could disable it by removing the bar that pushes on the door. However, this seems a little inconvenient if you wanted to disable it on a regular basis. The bar is threaded on one end and can be unscrewed.

Question: will it work in a heavy residential security door?
Answer: Make sure what ever it's screwed into is solid or it will pull the wood boarder right off of the wall.

Question: will it work in a heavy residential security door?
Answer: If you can swing without too much resistance, it probably can. The way it is designed, you can wind it up for more tension. It was probably meant for lighter doors but if the door can swing without too much effort or resistance, this probably would work.

Question: will it work in a heavy residential security door?
Answer: That depends on what you want it to do. It will keep the door mostly closed, but it is unlikely that the door will close all the way. Being on the hinge side of the door it takes quite a bit of torque to latch the door. If you need the door to close all the way you should probably look in to a commercial closer.

Question: How do you prep these inserts?  Is there a special wash routine prior to using them for the first time?
Answer: As with all natural fiber inserts, in order to get maximum absorbency, you will need to wash and dry a few times. You can use them after the first wash/dry cycle, but they become more absorbent after a few separate wash/dry cycles.

Question: How do you prep these inserts?  Is there a special wash routine prior to using them for the first time?

Question: Can these be used alone or they are doublers to be used under a Microfiber insert?
Answer: Hemp can absorb a lot, but they are slow absorbing. It should be used behind another insert, like a prefold or microfiber.

Question: Can these be used alone or they are doublers to be used under a Microfiber insert?
Answer: They could be used along, but are more effective under microfiber. Hemp absorbs a lot but slowly, so the microfiber helps to absorb the initial liquid quickly.

Question: Can these be used alone or they are doublers to be used under a Microfiber insert?

Question: Can this seat be used in vehicles that only have lap belts?
Answer: According to the user manual (which can be found on the Safety 1st website), the vehicle does not have to have a latch system in order to be used. In fact it does not need the latch system to be used with the upright back. HOWEVER, IT DOES REQUIRE "anchors" to use the upright back. These are the features that are located behind the headrest or behind the seat or on the floor behind the seat. Question: does natural finish imply that it has a wood stain or no wood stain?
Answer: Natural finish is a transparent finish which doesn't alter the original color of the grain of the natural wood. Natural finishes are usually provided by sealers, oils, Varnishes, water repellent preservatives and other similar materials. So yes it will have something over the wood....but it will still have the "natural wood" look to it without say, the splinters. ;)

Question: Can the glass sliding door be closed and locked while the gate is in place, or does the gate have to be removed first?

Question: Can the glass sliding door be closed and locked while the gate is in place, or does the gate have to be removed first?
Answer: No you have to removed the gate in order to close the door. The way the gate works is on one side of the gate is 2 u channel clamps that grip the sliding portion of the door. On the opposite side are 2 metal pads that slide into the vertical portion of the door frame. You then slide the door to the point where the gate is in between the frame and the door. They also give you a small clamp that you put on the bottom of the door frame to stop the door from opening. Hope this helps.

Question: Do you need to use cloth  diaper safe detergent with these to maintain absorbency?
Answer: Yes. The reason is that mainstream detergents have softeners brighteners, and dyes. The softeners coat te diapers and inserts making them "water proof" and they will not abdorb. The brighteners stick the diapers and cause skin irritation as well as the dyes. Stick with cloth diaper friendly detergent!

Question: Can it adjust the texture of the food? For example, food puree/mash for a 9 month old baby should be more rough than that of a 6 month old baby.

Question: Can it adjust the texture of the food? For example, food puree/mash for a 9 month old baby should be more rough than that of a 6 month old baby.
Answer: Yes you just simply pulse the food less for more texture

Question: Can it adjust the texture of the food? For example, food puree/mash for a 9 month old baby should be more rough than that of a 6 month old baby.
Answer: The blending is a manual thing. You hold the button until you are satisfied with the coarseness of the food. The longer you blend, the smoother the puree will be.

Question: Can it adjust the texture of the food? For example, food puree/mash for a 9 month old baby should be more rough than that of a 6 month old baby.
Answer: It doesn't adjust, you do. You just shorten the time that it's blending.

Question: Can it adjust the texture of the food? For example, food puree/mash for a 9 month old baby should be more rough than that of a 6 month old baby.
Answer: Yes.  You just don't process it for as long.

Question: Can it adjust the texture of the food? For example, food puree/mash for a 9 month old baby should be more rough than that of a 6 month old baby.
Answer: You control how pureed you want the food. You can choose to pulse only for a few seconds for a more textured outcome, or you can pulse until you see no more clumps for a very smooth purée. The containers are transparent so you can see what is happening to the food as you pulse. You stop when you have attained your desired consistency. Hope this helps!

Question: Can it adjust the texture of the food? For example, food puree/mash for a 9 month old baby should be more rough than that of a 6 month old baby.
Answer: Hi Yang -Yes you may adjust the consistency of your food through the blend function or by using the left over nutrient rich water after a steam cycle.- The BEABA Customer Support Team

Question: Are they supposed to fit loosely and spin?  This makes them more than a bit of a hassle when actually turning the stove burners on.
Answer: Yeah, they're meant to prevent children from turning the actual stove knobs. If the knobs turned with them, it'd defeat the purpose. :)

Question: Are they supposed to fit loosely and spin?  This makes them more than a bit of a hassle when actually turning the stove burners on.
Answer: Yes, they're suppose to do that.   If you want them not to spin, you will need a very thin, high temperature, double sided tape to anchor them.

Question: Are they supposed to fit loosely and spin?  This makes them more than a bit of a hassle when actually turning the stove burners on.
Answer: They do fit loose and spin so that if the child tries to turn they just go round and round. An adult should have no problem it's a simple rubber ribbed button just to push in and pop open turn the stove on and easily snaps back into place .

Question: Are they supposed to fit loosely and spin?  This makes them more than a bit of a hassle when actually turning the stove burners on.
Answer: Yes, the design of these stove knob covers is to fit loosely and spin to prevent the child from being able to access the stove/burner controls.  You should be able to easily access the knobs when needed by opening the knob cover (pressing in on the tab, then pivoting the cover up and out of the way to access the stove knob), then close the top of the cover back when you are done so the child, again, cannot access the controls.

Question: Are they supposed to fit loosely and spin?  This makes them more than a bit of a hassle when actually turning the stove burners on.

Question: Will this work on a pocket door?
Answer: No, at least not well.  It's really designed to mount on the edge of the door, with the plunger going up into a hole in the track.  To mount it on a pocket door, you'd either have to mount it on the side of the door, which would stop the door from sliding all the way into the pocket, or you'd have to mount it to the edge of the door, which would keep the door from closing all the way.If you can accept either of those conditions, it really is a nice product.

Question: how do you adjust height?
Answer: Adjusting the height is very simple. There are 3 slots at the lower end of each strap. Numbered 1-3; 1 being for the shortest or lightest baby. The straps are held in place under the seat frame with a small bar that you lift to unsnap and turn to put the bar into the desired slot and turn back to snap into position. Should only take a couple minutes.

Question: how do you adjust height?
Answer: The bars on the side have three different height levels u can adjust to so there feet always touch the ground

Question: how do you adjust height?

Question: how do you adjust height?
Answer: Hi Jocelyn,  the Jumperoo comes on the lowest adjustment marked as setting #1. Under the plastic top where the elastic straps meet the plastic top tray are metal pins. They un snap from under the top tray, you then simply pull each of the three elastic straps down through the top tray and reinsert the small metal pin through the sewn strap. It gives you the ability to raise the height of the top tray by one inch. It comes on setting #1, so you can raise it yourself to setting #2 or setting #3 raising it basicallt one inch each time. Hope that helps.

Question: Does the jumper fold up for storage?

Question: Does the jumper fold up for storage?
Answer: Not easily.  You have to pull the thee support poles that suspend the seat activity center out of the base.  Then the base separates by pushing a button and pulling up and sliding apart.  The base partially folds inward, but does not actually fold up.  To actual store it for extended period, better just to unsnap all the base and put the parts in a couple of heavy duty garbage bags and store the seat and pole the same to keep dust from accumulating. Your baby will enjoy the jumper, it's height adjustable, sturdy heavy base, but some what bulky to move from room to room.

Question: are the baby food trays any different than the breast milk trays?
Answer: Both the Milkies Milk Tray and the Milkies Food Tray provide you with 1 oz segmented storage for your ease in defrosting milk or food when needed. For women that used the Milkies Milk Trays to store breast milk, they can easily transition to using the tray for food storage. Question: Is this product worth it if baby is already on solids and their poop is more solid? Or best for the 'runnier' breastmilk poop?
Answer: Breastmilk poo doesn't need to be rinsed, but sometimes their poo when eating solids is more sticky, especially if they are still taking in a fair amount of milk/formula. Plus, you can use the sprayer to clean out the kid potty when toilet training, bidet for yourself (most are safe for using postpartum), rinsing around the rim of the toilet when you clean it, etc.

Question: Is this product worth it if baby is already on solids and their poop is more solid? Or best for the 'runnier' breastmilk poop?
Answer: Breastmilk poo is water soluble so you really don't need a sprayer...As soon as solid food hits you will be SO GLAD to have a diaper sprayer!! So nasty.  There will be times the poo will not just fall off as one would hope - it will sit inside every crevice of your diaper and without a sprayer or your hands you won't be able to get it off. This is one investment you will not regret! Signed, a mother of three (first time CDer)

Answer: The numbers indicate the temp of the heating unit,,,the higher number (3) heats the fastest and the lower numbers in a more leisurely time.Suggest you use the lower, as you may have to cool it down more often at '3', not something to do if you are breast feeding/pumping and having to open another container, waste some of the over-heated milk to make room for the cooler milk.  Or you could run the bottle under cold water for a period of time...so it is all about time...spend it now or spend it later.

Question: How does it work?  How do you know when you have the lid on tight enough?
Answer: It has a screw-on lid that has a rubber-type (silicone?) gasket.  The gasket has grooves in it that the liquid comes through, but only when there is sucking.  You know it's tight enough just by tightening it all the way-it doesn't click or anything.  They really are great, though-no straws to deal with when you're on the go!

Question: How does it work?  How do you know when you have the lid on tight enough?
Answer: The lid has a soft, silicone edge with small grooves in it.  As you tighten the lid down, the silicone gets "squished" and less liquid comes out.  To increase the flow, you loosen the lid a small amount and "un-squish" the silicone part.It is kind of trial and error to see when you have the lid on tight enough.

Question: How does it work?  How do you know when you have the lid on tight enough?
Answer: Works great. Just make sure gasket has the ridges facing out and just hand tighten the lid. It has never leaked on us so far. Hope this helps. If not just ask whatever other questions you may have. Good luck

Question: What if one just bends forward to get the correct anorectal angle? Will that be as good as using this?
Answer: No, the Squatty Potty puts you in the correct angle.  If you bend forward, you put pressure on your puburectalis muscle, making it harder to poop.  Using the Squatty Potty does the complete opposite.  It makes it easier to poop.  You raise your feet up onto the Squatty Potty, which in turn raises your legs and knees into the proper squatting position.  This makes it far easier to poop.

Question: What if one just bends forward to get the correct anorectal angle? Will that be as good as using this?

Question: Will this seat latch into the center position of the back seat?
Answer: some people use the two inner latch anchors of the side seats to install a car seat with latch in the center.  this is do able when the car seat has flexible fabric latch connectors, but usually not with rigid connectors because of the standard width of the latch anchors.  when using the two inside ones from the outer seats they typically end up being a little wider.  use both latch and the belt to install, and look up the maximum weight capability of the latch anchors per your vehicle, the seatbelt is usually a higher limit.

Question: what do you fasten the diapers with?
Answer: You don't have to fasten them if you trifold them and use them as an all-in-2 type of diaper with a waterproof wrap (just like Best Bottoms, but WAY better). You get the longest use out of them this way, since with this fold the width doesn't matter and they'll fit lengthwise a long time (the infant size will get you from birth to over a year easily--get the 4x8x4 for better absorbency). If you want to fold them the old-fashioned way, you'll need to secure them either with pins or a snappi/pair of boingos...but you'll also need to buy more sizes as the baby outgrows the width.

Question: Can this be used as a stand alone (not attached to the wall) gate? Does it have pressure connectors?

Question: Can it be hard-mounted to 2 perpendicular walls?

Question: Can it be hard-mounted to 2 perpendicular walls?
Answer: You should not have an issue as long as the length between the walls does not exceed the length of the gate itself. You can bend the gate at 90 degrees where the side panels meet the inner walk through gate. This is three panels that have fully rotational pieces where each of them meet eachother. So basically, it can be a 90 degree bend with two panels on one side and one on the other side. Hopefully this makes sense...good luck!

Question: Does VOX mode work with 2 cameras?  Meaning, will it turn off when all is quiet and then turn on when either camera detects noise?
Answer: You control vox on the main monitor, not the camera. Its either on or off as you select. When on, you press a button to speak and transmit.The cameras transmit one way audio and video at all times. The only way to send sound to the camera is to press a button on the monitor like a walkie talkie.

Question: can you use a differant monitior like a tablet or t.v

Question: When using two cameras, do you get split screen video and audio from both at the same time, or audio only by cycling between the two cameras?
Answer: There is no split-screen. You have to flip from one feed to the next for both audio and video--one view/audio feed at a time. However, there is a "scan" function that automatically rotates among the camera feeds very frequently, changing which camera it's on every few seconds, so while you can't see two rooms simultaneously, you can get views/audio of them in quick succession of each other. It seems frequent enough for you to feel like you have your eyes and ears on two places at once. Hope that helps!

Question: When using two cameras, do you get split screen video and audio from both at the same time, or audio only by cycling between the two cameras?
Answer: No split screen feature. But audio and video auto cycle between cameras.

Question: When using two cameras, do you get split screen video and audio from both at the same time, or audio only by cycling between the two cameras?
Answer: The monitor cycles between the two cameras with only the audio and video from one at a time.  It's not simultaneous on a split screen.

Question: Do you roll down the side in the middle of the night to get baby? Is this difficult?
Answer: The side goes down to use the unit as a "co-sleeper".  As a bassinet, it's not easy enough that you would want to put the side up and down in the middle of the night with a crying baby; but with the side rail up, it's only 30" high and about 12" deep to the mattress, so it's much easier to get your baby out than from a full size crib.

Question: Do you roll down the side in the middle of the night to get baby? Is this difficult?

Question: Can these be used with diaper rash cream (zinc oxide or aquaphor) to keep it off of the cloth diapers?

Answer: If you leave a baby in the same position with any seat/crib etc against their head for a prolonged period of time on a regular basis, they will develop flat spots on their heads. Question: does theses click. lock sippy cup come with leak proof valve cuz the 8 bottles i have all have broken opening valves. do you sell replacements?!!!
Answer: You actually don't want a sippy that would be very hard for a baby/ or child to get liquids from.  The mouth does not need to learn to suck and this can be detrimental, if it's always the way he/ she is drinking.  There is current research on this but it's a newer finding in the last couple of years. There are speech problems from them and palette formation issues.  Experts now suggest they only be used during a transition period between bottle and cup. It may be worth it to keep those kids carpets around until they're old enough to use cups without frequent spills.

Question: Is the blanket large enough   Or does it look too small in a standard size crib?

Question: Do battery packs need to be put in the parent units or can they be plugged into an outlet w/o and will work provided kept in power adapter all times
Answer: Battery packs must be installed into each parent unit.  The batteries are charged only when in the parent unit.  Once charged the parent unit can be disconnected from the power supply for about eight hours before they will need to be recharged (the instructions with the units will specify how much time to expect).  This allows users to move about with the parent unit while it monitors the baby unit (e.g. move to another room to complete a task).

Question: What is the différence between the city mini with two wheels in the front (2012) and the one with one wheel (2014)?
Answer: Most likely you are comparing the citi mini to the citi mini gt. The gt does have larger tires meant for hiking or going off the pavement, or just for extra stability. He two smaller wheels are standard stroller wheels meant for pavement only. Neither can be used for jogging.

Question: What is the différence between the city mini with two wheels in the front (2012) and the one with one wheel (2014)?
Answer: They are two different models. The two wheels in front (the cheaper model) has has small hard wheels front and back, which is good if most of your pushing is going to be done on hard surfaces that are even - concrete, bitumen, etc. The single wheel at the front is the mini GT. It's more expensive and has the air-filled tyres and wheel suspension, which allows a bit more of a comfortable ride for bubba on uneven surfaces such as boardwalks, dirt, grass, etc.

Question: What is the différence between the city mini with two wheels in the front (2012) and the one with one wheel (2014)?

Question: Is the car seat adapter convenient and easy to use or kind of awkward and bulky?

Question: Is the car seat adapter convenient and easy to use or kind of awkward and bulky?
Answer: It's convenient to use as it can stay attached to the pram at all times, even when folding and folded up. You can attach the capsule easily, then attach the strap (which is not difficult, but it is a  2 stage process). It's not as convenient as a travel system with an individual adapter for your capsule (as this is a one fits most adapter), but the plus is you can have a Baby Jogger stroller after your baby is finished in the capsule (around 6 months).

Question: is it safe for 4mo old babies?
Answer: It's okay for a infant to sleep in a cot during the 1st 6mos with you on his/her back side in eyesight to reduce the risk of SIDS (sudden death infant syndrome). Question: Do these wick moisture away from baby's skin?
Answer: These are made from cotton, so they don't wick moisture. But, when used inside of a pocket diaper, they soak up all the moisture away from the diaper itself, which keeps baby dry. If you put them inside the diaper, however, right up against baby, they're just going to absorb, not wick. As an insert, though, they are very good at keeping baby dry in combination with whatever material your diaper is made from.

Question: Does it meet flammability requirements in California?  It should say on the tag.
Answer: "Any item sold in the US has to meet CA requirements." That is not true. There are lots of products that are made without chemical flame retardants. In fact, CA just implemented a new law saying products do NOT have to meet the state's old flame retardant requirements because studies suggest the chemical flame retardants cause cancer. In Maine, there is a statewide ban on the chemical fire retardants that have been used to satisfy the old CA flame retardant rule (TB 117).

Question: Can you monitor SOUND from two cameras at the SAME TIME?  Or do you have to switch back and forth?
Answer: There is a scan function.  When on scan it spends a few seconds on the Sound and video on one camera and then spends a few seconds on the sound and video on the next camera until it goes through all of the cameras and then it goes back to the first camera and rotates through again.  It does the same thing with the sound when the picture on the monitor is off.

Question: Can you monitor SOUND from two cameras at the SAME TIME?  Or do you have to switch back and forth?
Answer: You have to switch back and forth. However, the monitor can scan between the different cameras, normally switching about every 10 seconds.

Question: Can you monitor SOUND from two cameras at the SAME TIME?  Or do you have to switch back and forth?
Answer: The camera's SCAN mode allows you to rotate between up to four cameras (switching both the audio & video output on the parent unit).  According to the manual, when on SCAN mode the video & audio rotate between cameras every 12 seconds.

Question: The Britax Chapperone does not go in shopping carts. Does the B-safe??
Answer: No infant car seat should ever be placed in a shopping cart on the top part where the child seat is.  All infant car seats come with warnings about this.  Babies have died because the car seat fell off of the shopping cart.  Do not do this.  Instead, hang the car seat sideways over the deep part of the cart so that most of the car seat is inside the cart but hanging from the sides of the cart.  You can still put stuff underneath the car seat and to the side of the car seat in the cart and your baby will be much much safer.  Hope this helps.

Question: will mat adhere to a slightly textured tub surface or is smooth surface required?
Answer: It will probably stick - the adhesive is very strong.  A flat surface gives you a completely sealed mat - nothing gets under it. The height of your texture will impact the seal you get.  So if you are more concerned about creating a non slip surface - it will meet your needs. If you are buying to eliminate the build up that you get with standard bath mats - the height of your texture will determine if you can get an airtight seal. If you do not have an airtight seal - water and soap residue will get under the mat.

Question: At what age is it OK to have the baby ride in this stroller (vs connecting the car seat)?

Question: At what age is it OK to have the baby ride in this stroller (vs connecting the car seat)?

Question: At what age is it OK to have the baby ride in this stroller (vs connecting the car seat)?
Answer: Most running websites recommend that you refrain from running with this type of stroller with a child younger than 6 months, UNLESS the child is belted into the car seat. Note that the car seat must be strapped down, and not placed loosely between the seat back and the tray portion of this stroller.

Question: At what age is it OK to have the baby ride in this stroller (vs connecting the car seat)?
Answer: Of course, it will be your call--because all children grow at a different pace--but when your baby is able to sit up on his/her own and won't slump over in the stroller seat when you turn it, then there is no need for a car seat. You can place blankets on either side of him/her, if that is a concern still, though they might slip.

Question: Must you use the seatbelt or may you also use the latch system (tether to seat)?

The top tether can be used in both installations but you may not use both the latch and seat belt to install the carseat in the belt path. When using as a booster you may use the latch to secure the seat to the car and use the seat belt to secure the child to the seat.

Question: Proposition 65 warning Does anyone know why there is a CA proposition 65 warning posted with this product (see under Product Details)?

Question: Proposition 65 warning Does anyone know why there is a CA proposition 65 warning posted with this product (see under Product Details)?
Answer: Many companies are putting the warning on everything they make as a safety measure if their product gets shipped to California. The Prop 65 lawsuits have gotten out of control in California and it has everyone scared. Testing is very difficult and expensive to prove you are prop 65 compliant and the requirements change every year.What started out as a good way to make safer products has turned into a financial boom for law firms in Californian and the state of california.

Question: Can the valves be used to control the flow of milk to the child? ie. if the desire is to slow the flow vs. without a valve it just comes out.

Question: Can the valves be used to control the flow of milk to the child? ie. if the desire is to slow the flow vs. without a valve it just comes out.
Answer: Yes. The valve itself has two speeds. If you insert the valve one way it is a spill proof slow speed (good for young toddlers). If you insert the valve on the opposite side it is faster (good for older toddlers).  Additionally, if you don't insert the valve at all it will be the fastest speed, but will also pour out if tipped upside down. Removing the valve all together means it is no longer spill proof.

Question: Can the valves be used to control the flow of milk to the child? ie. if the desire is to slow the flow vs. without a valve it just comes out.
Answer: Yes, The Valves control the flow it has a picture of a "Turtle" for slow... on one side and a "Rabbit" for fast... on the other side. Without the valve it just pours out.

Question: Can the valves be used to control the flow of milk to the child? ie. if the desire is to slow the flow vs. without a valve it just comes out.

Question: It says this is a pressure mounted gate, are screws needed at all to mount this gate?
Answer: If you are mounting the gate in a door frame, no screws are needed. However if one or both sides are up against a wall--say at the top of the stairs--then you'll need screws to mount the stabilizing "cups." These are small plastic holders similar to the things you put under bed frames or furniture. They give the gate stability so that it can't be slid along the wall if someone were to push firmly against it.

Question: Does anyone know if the wood is FSC certified or what the finishes are made of?
Answer: Thank you for your inquiry. The wood is New Zealand Pine. The wood stain is a water based stain, that has no VOC's (Volatile Organic Compounds). Also, the FSC Wood is the Forest Stewardship Council.  It pertains to wood that is endangered. As an example of an endangered wood would be Mahogany. All woods that are used in all Orbelle Products, are wood that has been grown for furniture, or other complaint products. If you have any additional questions, please do not hesitate to let us know.

Question: What does "3 months +/ BPA FREE" mean?
Answer: 3months+ means it is suitable for babies over 3 months & BPA "stands for bisphenol A. BPA is an industrial chemical that has been used to make certain plastics and resins since the 1960s. BPA is found in polycarbonate plastics and epoxy resins. Polycarbonate plastics are often used in containers that store food and beverages, such as water bottles. They may also be used in other consumer goods."

Question: Do the figurines stand up on their own or do they topple over?
Answer: The figures can stand on their own yet they topple pretty easily because they are light weight.  Pretty much anything made of fabric will fall over if brushed lightly, or if the table it is on is bumped. This nativity set is meant to be played with rather than used as a display and little ones don't seem to mind if a figure happens to fall over.  The figure is either "sleeping" or it gets picked up and reset.  And it really takes nothing to "moosh" the stuffing inside and work it around to create a more stable base for a figure to stand.  Enjoy the set!

Question: Is this stroller good for walking on unpaved or dirt paths?

Question: What material is better for the spring and summer months?

If the room is cool, then fleece exterior may be best.  Also depends on how your baby regulates their temp.  If they run warmer, then cotton may be best.  Hope this helps.

Once your baby can roll in the Magic Sleepsuit it is time to transition out.

Question: Can you use this when baby is 8 months and flipping over?

Question: it comes in micro fleece or cotton. What is the difference? which is better?

Question: it comes in micro fleece or cotton. What is the difference? which is better?
Answer: Both versions have a jersey cotton inner layer and the same amount of polyfil.  The only difference is the outer layer - cotton in one and microfleece in the other.  If you are looking to maximize breathability, the cotton would probably be your better option.

Question: Biggest criticism with Baby Bjorn carrier is backache that occurs in parents using it. Does this model address this issue?
Answer: No, backache is still a problem. The baby carrying "slot" is separated from the adult's body by an interior piece of fabric connected to the shoulderstraps, therefore replacing the weight that should be resting directly on the adult's body, with weight bearing on their hips, and replacing that portion of weight on the shoulders. By connecting the inner part of the carrier to the shoulder straps rather than the outer part of the carrier, the center of gravity for the child is much farther away from the adult's body, making the adult overadjust with their shoulders and back.

Question: What are the differences between the Oma and the Oma+? Thanks! :)
Answer: The Oma only has an audible alarm if it detects no or irregular movements. The Oma+ will vibrate first to encourage the baby to resume or regulate breathing before sounding the alarm. Question: Is it compatible with strollers to make a travel system
Answer: No, this is a convertible car seat. Usually only infant only, bucket-style car seats make stroller systems. This can be used from birth to booster seat age. It rear faces and forward faces. If you do start with an infant only bucket seat, then you would need to transition to a convertible anyway later on. Children need to be rear facing to at least age 2, and ideally as close to age 4 as possible.

Question: what are the height requirements
Answer: The rear facing limits are 19-40inches and head within an inch of the shell. Forward facing is 29-54 inches, ears contained within shell and harness at or above shoulders . Has a19"harness height, tallest torso height convertible on the market.

Question: Does this seat work like a 3-in-1, where it can become a booster for the older child?

Question: Will these be sufficient in the event of an earthquake?
Answer: Depends on the earthquake, how you install them and where you install them. If the wall comes down, well, the straps and furniture will come with it. If you install them not in a stud, a good shaker might pull them out of the wall. It is definitely better than NO straps, AND if you have little one's keeps the furniture from toppling forward if they start climbing up it.

Question: Can you operate it with one hand while carrying a baby?
Answer: No, impossible. You need one hand to continually press and turn the locking lever down to release the lock, and the other hand to unhook and support the fabric section as you roll it to open or shut.   You can't let go of the gate as you are opening it, otherwise it all flops down, and twists up as it reels in, which will then give you another problem, because if that happens it won't roll out flat with an equal tension top and bottom the next time you try to close it.

Question: Would this seat be appropriate for a 6 month old who weighs 20 lbs (carseat minimum), developmentally-speaking? He is quite young to be so heavy.
Answer: It was recommended to keep children rear-facing until at a MINIMUM they are 1 year and 20 lbs, but it is now strongly recommended to keep children rear-facing for as long as possible (to the rear-facing maximum of your car seat). Keeping your child rear-facing beyond age 2 has great safety benefits related to head/neck/spine injury. The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends keeping children rear-facing until age 2, or until they exceed the rear-facing height/weight limit of the car seat.

Question: Does the seat attach using the LATCH system?
Answer: It does have LATCH. However, LATCH has a 40 pound weight limit, so once your child is 40 pounds, you have to use a seat belt. Also, it has only one LATCH belt, like a typical car seat, where the Marathon, Advocate, and other Britax convertibles have two independent latch belts (one on each side attached to the steel integrated bars). This has a single strap, with a LATCH buckle on each end.

Question: Does the seat attach using the LATCH system?
Answer: You can use latch or seatbelt

Question: Does the seat attach using the LATCH system?

Question: what is the exact difference between this and the frontier 90 besides the weight. can someone please explain the latch and the seat belt detail plz
Answer: The frontier 90 has a very different method of buckling in. It has a Click-tight, where the interior of the seat lifts up, you buckle it in, and close down the seat-back, like a giant locking clip. The seat belt installation of this particular seat is in an odd, high placement, and makes it difficult to install on bench-style seats. The latch is a single strap with a push-button clip on each end, like Graco, but with an easier release. Basically, this is the low-end model. Still safe, if you have the correct style seats in you car.

Question: what is the exact difference between this and the frontier 90 besides the weight. can someone please explain the latch and the seat belt detail plz

Question: Is there something that mounts permanently to the outside of the cabinet, or just the magnet on the inside?

Question: Is there something that mounts permanently to the outside of the cabinet, or just the magnet on the inside?
Answer: Nothing on the outside. Two pieces are mounted on the inside, one on the door frame one on the cabinet frame. You use the part that looks like a key to open door. Just slide it on the outside, you will hear a little click and it will open! Check out some of the YouTube videos, they help

Question: Is there something that mounts permanently to the outside of the cabinet, or just the magnet on the inside?
Answer: There is a small piece that mounts on the inside of the cabinet and then the larger piece with magnet mounts to the door of the cabinet.

Question: Is there something that mounts permanently to the outside of the cabinet, or just the magnet on the inside?
Answer: There is not a permanent mount to the outside of the cabinet. The lock system has one magnetic lock, a latch (both screw into the inside of the cabinet with short screws) and a magnetic key. The key releases the lock when it is placed over the lock from the outside of the cabinet. Does that help?

You measure out however many scoops of formula you need to match however many ounces you put in the bottles.  The container stores in the bottle until you are ready to feed baby.  Then just dump powdered formula into the water and mix.

Question: Is the cap on these dispensers tight enough so that when you shake formula for mixing, it doesn't leak. Or are you just supposed to store dry formula
Answer: Containers are made just to store formula, not to mix. Covers are right enough and fit in 5oz and 9oz sized bottles. Real space saver.

Question: Is the cap on these dispensers tight enough so that when you shake formula for mixing, it doesn't leak. Or are you just supposed to store dry formula
Answer: You don't mix them that way. You fill the bottle with appropriate amount of water and the formula dispenser with appropriate amount of formula. When you are ready to mix, remove the top from the dispenser, pour the formula into the bottle, tap the sides of the dispenser to insure that you get all of the formula, screw the top on the bottle, then shake.

Question: Does each cup have different hole sizes or number of holes so that the water comes out differently?
Answer: Yes, each cup has a different number of holes and each cup has a different shape on the bottom where the holes are. Starting from the biggest to the smallest:-the first shape is a flower and has 6 holes-the second is a star and has 5 holes-the third is a square and has 4 holes-the fourth is a triangle and has 3 holes-the fifth is a circle and has 2 holesThe more holes in the cup, of course, the faster the water comes out.Hope this helps!

Question: What does "Memory Free" mean in the description?
Answer: Older batteries used to be susceptible to "memory" meaning if you kept charging it when it was only 1/2 discharged it would eventually think it was dead at 1/2 full.  Memory free means you can charge it whenever you feel like it without worrying about the memory thing.

Question: What does "Memory Free" mean in the description?
Answer: Sometimes, if a NiCd or NiMH rechargeable battery is repeatedly recharged after being only partially discharged, it may lose its maximum capacity.  This is referred to as battery memory.  It is as if the battery only "remembers" the smaller capacity.  So the product description is stating that this product is not susceptible to this effect.

Question: What's the advantage of the glass bottle over the normal plastic ones?

Question: What's the advantage of the glass bottle over the normal plastic ones?

Question: What's the advantage of the glass bottle over the normal plastic ones?

Also don't ever heat plastic bottles because that makes the plastic get into the milk much easier.

Question: does it come with base
Answer: Convertible car seats, like this one, do not have a separate base like infant car seats do. The seat and base are permanently connected and install as one unit. To switch cars, the whole seat must be disconnected and reconnected with the LATCH system or car seat belts. However, the seat's recline relative to the base can be adjusted.

Question: does it come with base
